author: m.kalinin
content: There would need to be a slashed validator that is eligible to become a proposer. Likely someone will need to slash itself in the middle of upgrade rollout when there is no majority on either side of the upgrade

author: m.kalinin
content: I am not trying to say that uncoordinated upgrade is completely safe, but the probability of a split to happen is much lower than usually, and I have been convinced that we should do this in coordination

author: potuz
content: This is not so unlikely ifv there's some large slashing. And in those circumstances the very last place we want to be is on a split. My first impression about these changes is that it's part of those things that would have been nice to know beforehand in 2020. Given the status quo I believe it's probably better to leave it as is, and if we get to a point that the percentage of slashed validators bug the throughput of the network, then we can come back and change this

author: m.kalinin
content: I agree, testing and coordination efforts with no tangible outcome make this change unlikely to happen
